info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 17 at 12:18PM CDT until April 17 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MORRIS AND CENTRAL TITUS COUNTIES... At 1217 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mount Pleasant, moving east at 30 mph. Ping pong ball size hail was reported with this storm just east of Winfielf. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Daingerfield, Omaha, Cason, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Cookville and Roeder. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
